attributes.title: Northwest Travel Medicine Clinic

body.value:
Travel and tropical medicine care and prevention in North Seattle

At Northwest Travel Medicine Clinic, our mission is to keep you healthy while abroad. Our providers specialize in comprehensive travel and tropical medicine. We’re a Washington State Department of Health-authorized provider for yellow fever vaccine, and provide a full range of travel and nontravel related vaccines on site. We recommend making a pre-travel clinic appointment four to six weeks before your departure to allow for appropriate timing of vaccines. We also provide follow-up care in case you bring back more than just souvenirs.

Our physicians are board-certified in infectious disease, internal medicine, and pediatrics. We also routinely see children for travel-related visits. Northwest Travel Medicine Clinic offers pre-travel consultations, post-travel evaluations and, in some cases, support while you travel.

One of our infectious disease specialists will meet with you for a comprehensive review of your health history and immunizations and to provide travel advice tailored to your itinerary. Once you have received your immunizations, you will receive a Certificate of Vaccination, which is required for entry in many foreign countries.

Examples of common services we offer include management of chronic medical conditions while traveling; malaria prevention; self-treatment for traveler’s diarrhea; avoidance of illness related to food, water, animals, insects and other exposures; and prevention of injury and altitude sickness.

Many other vaccinations are available onsite, including cholera, yellow fever, Japanese encephalitis, polio, typhoid, hepatitis A/B, meningitis, rabies, shingles, measles/mumps/rubella, tetanus/diptheria/pertussis and more.

We accept new patient referrals from primary care providers and specialists. You may be referred to our clinic when an infection is difficult to diagnose, does not initially respond to treatment or requires specialized or intravenous therapy.

You can call the clinic directly at 206.668.1630 to inquire about an appointment.

attributes.title: Virology Clinic at UWMC-Roosevelt

body.value:
HIV treatment and disease management on Roosevelt

The Virology Clinic at UWMC-Roosevelt provides primary and specialty care for persons living with HIV. We also provide pre-exposure prophylaxis (PrEP) for HIV prevention.

Our physicians specialize in HIV treatment and will work closely with you, providing individualized approaches to suppress HIV, minimize symptoms and side effects, and manage your other health needs holistically. Our HIV specialty pharmacist and social worker will also work with you to achieve your health goals.

attributes.title: Kidney Genetics Clinic at Harborview

body.value:
Genetic-based kidney disease diagnosis and testing at Harborview

The Kidney Genetics Clinic at Harborview Medical Center assists with diagnosis and testing when a referring provider suspects genetic kidney disease. We perform testing through the UW Center for Precision Diagnostics, a federally-certified lab specializing in genetic testing.

Genetic counseling is available before and after testing to help patients understand the implications of the findings. Individual tests for specific genes are available, along with multigene tests for various conditions of interest.

For some patients, we focus on providing genetic diagnostic services, and the patients return for ongoing care to their referring provider. For others, we provide comprehensive care for chronic kidney disease management.

For more information about services provided at the Kidney Genetics Clinic, read our fact sheet.

attributes.title: Center for Pain Relief at UWMC-Roosevelt

body.value:
Compassionate, multidisciplinary pain diagnosis and treatment on Roosevelt

When ongoing pain prevents you from meeting your goals for a meaningful and productive life, it’s time to speak with your usual care provider to see if a visit to the Center for Pain Relief at UW Medical Center-Roosevelt would be helpful to you.

We provide consultation for patients from across Washington state and the Pacific Northwest, and are known as a center of clinical excellence at a national level. 

Our world-renowned team focuses on the diagnosis and treatment of people with ongoing pain. We provide multispecialty coordinated care and a wide range of advanced imaging techniques (3-D CT scanner, fluoroscopy and ultrasound), non-opioid medication and integrative medicine approaches, including training in relaxation and coping.

We diagnose and treat complex and persistent pain resulting from a wide range of musculoskeletal and neurological pain conditions, including but not limited to arthritis and rheumatologic disorders; diabetes; cancer; neuropathy; surgery; chronic headaches; fibromyalgia; myofascial, visceral and pelvic pain.

attributes.title: Anesthesiology Clinical Services at UW Medical Center

body.value:
Full-spectrum anesthesia services and clinical research at UWMC

The Department of Anesthesiology & Pain Medicine Division at the University of Washington Medical Center provides a wide range of anesthesia services, leading-edge research and advances in various areas of anesthesia. Our anesthesiologists are experts in the most advanced anesthesiology and pain management options available.

Our clinical anesthesia services include:

  • Preoperative medical/surgical evaluations
  • General and regional anesthetics
  • Labor epidurals
  • Postoperative pain management
  • Acute care services
  • Moderate/deep sedation services
  • Transplantation anesthesia for liver and kidney transplantation

We provide these services in both inpatient and outpatient settings:

  • 28 operating rooms
  • 11 out-of-OR locations
  • 2 OR ambulatory surgical centers
  • Surgical Intensive Care Units and Cardiothoracic Intensive Care Unit
  • Preoperative Assessment Clinic
  • Pain Management Center

We have several high-tier clinical and basic research programs. Many of our clinical anesthesiologists are actively engaged and funded by organizations such as the National Institutes of Health (NIH), Foundation for Education Research (NFER), and American Pain and Safety Foundation investigating drug safety, neural blockade in anesthesia, glucose homeostasis and management, and operating room science.

attributes.title: Kidney Clinic at Harborview

body.value:
Treatment at Harborview for adult patients who deal with kidney diseases, dialysis and transplants

Located on the 7th Floor of the Norm Maleng Building, the Kidney Clinic at Harborview Medical Center specializes in difficult-to-control hypertension, medical kidney disease of all types, kidney stone diseases and acid-based and fluid balance disorders. 

We help adult patients with kidney failure undergoing hemodialysis and peritoneal dialysis.  We also treat kidney transplant patients including adjusting their transplant medications.

We provide comprehensive, quality service to our patients while simultaneously training future generations of physicians. We also participate in clinical research projects that seek to improve quality of life for patients with kidney disease.

attributes.title: Glomerular Disease Kidney Clinic at UWMC

body.value:
The region’s premier treatment center for glomerular kidney diseases at UW Medicine

The Glomerular Disease Clinic at UW Medical Center provides compassionate and comprehensive care for patients with glomerular diseases, which affect kidney function by attacking the glomeruli, the tiny kidney filters that clean blood.

We partner with regional providers throughout the Pacific Northwest to diagnose and treat patients who have a variety of glomerular diseases, including minimal change disease, focal segmental glomerulosclerosis, membranous nephropathy, membranoproliferative glomerulonephritis, lupus nephritis and glomerular disease from vasculitis and paraproteins.

We are dedicated to advancing the understanding and treatment of glomerular diseases through clinical care, education and research.

attributes.title: Kidney Care & Transplantation Services at UWMC

body.value:
Comprehensive kidney care at UW Medicine before and after transplantation

Kidney Care & Transplantation Services, which also includes the General Nephrology Clinic at UW Medical Center, treats patients with all forms of kidney disease — offering state-of-the-art care, access to new treatment studies and traditional therapies.

If you or a loved one have end-stage renal disease, Kidney Care & Transplantation Services offers comprehensive and compassionate care with a special emphasis on living-donor kidney transplantation. If you are interested in donating a kidney, please take this potential living kidney donor screening and our independent donor advocate will follow up with you. To learn more about living kidney donation, review this overview​.

UW Medicine’s transplant team is experienced at planning and performing sophisticated living-donor transplants. Each of our nephrologists and surgeons has more than 10 years’ experience in living donation, and patients looking into transplant or post-transplant treatment also have access to research studies focusing on new medications to prevent rejection of transplanted kidneys.

Our clinic also provides specialized care to people with genetically transmitted kidney diseases, high blood pressure, kidney stones and kidney disease in the context of pregnancy, diabetes and cancer.

For Kidney Transplant Referrals:

Phone: 206.598.3882
Fax:     ​206.598.7176

For General Nephrology Referrals:

Phone: 206.598.6267
Fax:     206.598.3621

To fax documents, please use the clinic fax number: 206.598.7176

attributes.title: Infectious Disease at Northwest Hospital

body.value:
Full-spectrum infectious disease and travel care at Northwest Hospital

The Northwest Infectious Disease Clinic provides inpatient and outpatient consultations along with leading-edge diagnosis and treatment for a wide range of infections.

You may be referred to our clinic when an infection is difficult to diagnose, does not initially respond to treatment or requires specialized or intravenous therapy. Conditions we routinely treat include hepatitis B and C, HIV, endocarditis, osteomyelitis, hospital acquired infections, fungal infections, tuberculosis, cellulitis, sexually transmitted infections, surgical infections and travel-related illness.

Our physicians are board-certified in infectious disease, internal medicine and pediatrics, and we routinely see children for travel-related visits. We require referrals from primary care providers and specialists for new patients.

attributes.title: Bronchoscopy Suite at UW Medical Center

body.value:
Minimally invasive lung evaluations at UW Medical Center

The University of Washington Medical Center’s Bronchoscopy Suite provides minimally invasive procedures to evaluate problems with the lungs, lung lining (pleural spaces) and lymph nodes within the chest.

Bronchoscopy is performed by pulmonologists and uses a thin, flexible, lighted camera to look directly into the airway while topical and intravenous sedation is provided for patient comfort. The procedure is often combined with fluid sampling or biopsy in order to diagnose infection, cancer, inflammatory conditions or other types of lung disease. In addition to bronchoscopy, other procedures performed in the suite include thoracentesis, in which fluid from the lung’s lining can be removed to diagnose similar conditions or relieve breathing difficulty.

Other providers in the bronchoscopy suite include nurses, respiratory therapists and medical assistants. Procedures are often coordinated with other appointments—including clinic visits and CT scans—with bronchoscopists working closely with other pulmonologists, radiologists and pathologists to manage a variety of conditions.

attributes.title: Lung Function Testing Clinic at UW Medical Center

body.value:
Expert diagnostic lung testing at UW Medical Center

When you need expert testing to help diagnose lung problems, your first stop should be the Lung Function Testing Clinic at UW Medical Center.

Our testing services includes spirometry, airway resistance, lung volume measurements, nitrogen washout and plethsmography. Our staff also performs complex pulmonary, progressive cardio-pulmonary and simple walking exercises. We draw and analyze blood to evaluate oxygen saturation, and we also assist with pleural biopsies.

All of our testing meets or exceeds the standards set by the American Thoracic Society.

attributes.title: Genetic Medicine Clinic at UW Medical Center

body.value:
Comprehensive genetic medicine care

The Genetic Medicine Clinic at UW Medical Center is the only genetics clinic for adults in the Pacific Northwest that offers the full range of evaluation, diagnosis, assessment, genetic testing and interpretation, counseling and care management for all genetic and genomic disorders. We also offer resource referrals to individuals who have genetic disorders in their families or disorders thought to have a genetic component.

Our physicians specializing in medical genetics  treat conditions across  the spectrum from inherited cancer syndromes to biochemical genetic disorders, neurogenetic disorders, connective tissue disorders, cardiogenetics and inherited skin conditions. Our licensed genetic counselors offer risk assessment and counseling for cancers,  along with pre-pregnancy genetic counseling and testing.

attributes.title: Pre-Anesthesia Clinic at UW Medical Center

body.value:
Pre-operative consultations and anesthesia assessments at UW Medical Center

Your surgeon determined that you should undergo a diagnostic or therapeutic procedure. To ensure that you are ready for surgery, you may be referred to the Pre-Anesthesia Clinic for assessment.

Our anesthesiology faculty and nursing staff will work with you to understand your current health status and risk factors to tailor the safest course of anesthesia and pain management before, during and immediately after your procedure.

The pre-anesthesia visit is a good time to ask questions about what will happen on the day of your surgery. To help us provide the highest level of care, please bring with you to your Pre-Anesthesia Clinic visit:

  • A list of all the medicines you take, including times and dosages. It is important for us to know about all the medicines you are taking—you may need to stop taking some of them for a day or more before your surgery.
  • The results of tests you have had at any other hospital or clinic, especially heart or lung diagnostic testing such as an EKG, stress test, echocardiogram or pulmonary function tests.

attributes.title: General Surgery Clinic at Harborview

body.value:
Complete pre- and post-surgery care and consultations at Harborview

The General Surgery Clinic at Harborview provides consultation for general and surgical conditions, as well as pre- and post-operative follow-up for patients with traumatic injuries, wound management and suture removal.

We also perform minor operations in our specially equipped ambulatory procedures area including cyst and skin tag removals, incision and drainage of abscesses, rigid sigmoidoscopies and hemorrhoid evaluation and management. Following an initial consultation, these procedures will usually be scheduled for a subsequent visit.

Clinic staff are available by phone until 4:30pm to answer your questions.

attributes.title: Hepatology Clinic at Eastside Specialty Center

body.value:
Expert care for acute and chronic liver disorders

Located at the Eastside Specialty Center in Bellevue, our Hepatology Clinic provides innovative, comprehensive care for patients with acute and chronic liver disorders.

Our highly trained multidisciplinary liver care team includes dedicated hepatologists, hepatobiliary surgeons, medical and surgical oncologists, diagnostic and interventional radiologists and nurse coordinators — each with specialized knowledge about liver function and disease.

We provide outstanding care for simple and complex liver conditions. Whether you're seeking a diagnosis, managing a chronic condition or need care for a toxic liver injury, we provide the full range of treatment options based on the latest research protocols.

attributes.title: Hypertension Clinic at Harborview

body.value:
Advanced hypertension care at Harborview

A diagnosis of hypertension, or high blood pressure, can be life-changing. If left untreated, the disease can lead to a number of other health conditions, including coronary artery disease, heart attack, heart failure, stroke and kidney failure. At the Hypertension Clinic at Harborview, our goal is to help you avoid these complications through a high-quality, comprehensive and team-based approach to patient care.​

Patients are typically referred to the Hypertension Clinic when they have hypertension that is difficult to control and is being treated with three or more types of medication; a provider suspects a secondary or reversible cause of hypertension, such as narrowing of an artery, a hormonal abnormality or an inherited genetic condition; or a patient has a strong family history of hypertension.

In some cases, the Hypertension Clinic incorporates the use of ambulatory blood pressure monitoring, a technique that utilizes a small, wearable device to take measurements of a patient’s blood pressure over a 24- to 48-hour period. This technique provides the most accurate method for determining blood pressure at home, and can be used in some patients to more accurately assess cardiovascular risk.

The clinic is located on the 7th floor of the Norm Maleng Building at Harborview Medical Center.

attributes.title: Cardiac Fitness Center

body.value:
Life-changing cardiac rehabilitation in a state-of-the-art facility

The Cardiac Fitness Center is a contemporary, well-equipped facility that hosts Northwest Hospital's Cardiac Rehabilitation Program, which helps support recovery for cardiac patients, reduce risk for further cardiovascular disease, and increase overall health, fitness and well-being.

Northwest Hospital’s Cardiac Rehabilitation Program has operated for 20 years. The program is certified by the American Association of Cardiovascular and Pulmonary Rehabilitation and is staffed by a medically-trained, multidisciplinary team of nurses, exercise physiologists and dietitians, with oversight by a board-certified cardiologist.

Located in the McMurray Building on the Northwest Hospital campus, the Cardiac Fitness Center is outfitted with state-of-the-art monitoring devices, the latest exercise equipment, and dressing rooms with lockers and showers.

Patients enrolled in the Cardiac Rehabilitation Program participate in exercise sessions supervised by critical care nurses and exercise physiologists specializing in cardiac rehabilitation. Exercise classes are conducted with treadmills and stationary bicycles, as well as hand weights, yoga balls, and other stretching and toning equipment. A cardiologist is on call during all sessions.

In addition to exercise, educational classes provide patients with information they need to reduce cardiac risk factors and make lasting lifestyle changes. A referral from a physician is required for enrollment in the program.

attributes.title: Transplant Services at UW Medical Center

body.value:
Complete transplant care backed by the expertise and research of UW Medicine

Transplant Services at UW Medical Center combines the clinical, academic and research activities of the transplantation and cardiothoracic surgery divisions at UW Medicine.

Our board-certified surgeons perform most of the multi-organ procurements in Washington, Alaska, Montana and northern Idaho. We’re organized around the following multidisciplinary clinical teams, all of which provide transplant care with compassion, integrity and respect for individual dignity: heart transplantation, kidney-pancreas transplantation, liver transplantation, lung transplantation, intestinal transplantation and reconstructive transplantation (face, hand, abdominal wall).

Through Seattle Children's, we offer pediatric kidney, liver and heart transplantation services. UW Medical Center also offers programs in autologous bone marrow transplants and high-dose chemotherapy. 

Learn more about UW Medicine Transplant Care.

attributes.title: Cardiology Clinic at Eastside Specialty Center

We also provide direct access to specialized cardiac services at University of Washington Medical Center for those patients who require advanced procedures or complex surgeries.

attributes.title: Northwest Endocrinology

body.value:
Endocrine, diabetes and metabolic disorder care at Northwest Hospital

Northwest Endocrinology at Northwest Hospital & Medical Center is an independent clinic specializing in endocrinology, diabetes and metabolic disorders. We have evaluated, treated and provided quality care to patients for more than 20 years.

To help improve and maintain a patient’s health, our board certified endocrinologist works closely with our nurse practitioner and clinical dietitian to carefully evaluate the relationship between nutrition and human disease.

Our care providers are committed to providing their patients with the best care possible. They feel strongly that continuity of care is integral to healthy outcomes. Continuity of care is the process by which you and your care providers work cooperatively in ongoing healthcare management with the goal of providing high quality, cost-effective medical care.

attributes.title: Intestinal Care and Transplantation Clinic at UW Medical Center

body.value:
Comprehensive treatment for intestinal failure or dysfunction at UW Medical Center

Healthcare providers at the Intestinal Care and Transplantation Clinic at UW Medical Center provide compassionate and comprehensive care for people with intestinal failure. Physicians across the Pacific Northwest refer patients to our program — a testament to our staff’s experience and our patients’ outcomes.

We treat intestinal failure which results in conditions including inflammatory bowel disease, trauma, volvulus, thrombus, pseudo-obstruction, necrotizing enterocolitis and gastroschisis.

Our surgeons, physicians, nurses, dieticians and pharmacists have years of experience managing cases of intestinal dysfunction or failure.

Our patients have access to the latest treatments and ample opportunities to participate in multiple research trials aimed at better understanding disease and refining treatments.

attributes.title: Liver Transplant Clinic at UW Medical Center

body.value:
Specialized, comprehensive care before and after liver transplant surgery

Located at University of Washington Medical Center, our Liver Transplant Clinic provides comprehensive pre- and post-transplant liver care based on pioneering research and the latest clinical protocols.

Our skilled, dedicated team includes transplant hepatologists, liver transplant surgeons, transplant infectious disease specialists, nurse coordinators, transplant social workers and dietitians — each with specialized knowledge about liver disease and transplant care.

We work closely with the UW Medical Center liver transplant team to perform transplants using both deceased and living liver donors, both with excellent patient outcomes.

We provide expert pre-liver transplant evaluations for patients with serious liver disease. We also offer a liver transplant protocol for select patients with cholangiocarcinoma (bile duct cancer) and evaluate for multi-organ transplantation.

Our post-liver transplant providers deliver long-term compassionate care to our liver transplant recipients, including immunosuppression management and education on reaching and maintaining optimal health.

attributes.title: Endocrine and Diabetes Care Center at UWMC-Roosevelt

body.value:
Complete treatment and support for diabetes and endocrine disorders

The Endocrine and Diabetes Care Center at UW Medical Center-Roosevelt offers a complete set of treatment, education and support services to diagnose and treat endocrine conditions and diabetes.

Our board-certified physicians treat a variety of thyroid, adrenal and calcium disorders; osteoporosis and metabolic bone diseases; male and female reproductive disorders; and polycystic ovary syndrome. Our endocrine tumor program provides advanced specialty care for patients with benign and malignant disease of the thyroid, parathyroid and adrenal glands. UW Medicine has the only endocrine tumor program in the region that offers dosimetry for radioactive iodine as a treatment.

We also serve people with type 1 or type 2 diabetes, pre- and post-transplant diabetes and pancreatic diabetes, and we specialize in services for youth with diabetes who are transitioning into adult care. The Adolescent and Young Adult Diabetes Transition Clinic includes adult and pediatric care providers from the Diabetes Care Center and Seattle Children’s Hospital.

We work as a team to assist patients in becoming independent and active participants in their diabetes care. Our certified diabetes-education nurses provide patient support and resources, registered dietitians offer individualized nutritional counseling and our clinical pharmacists are specialists in diabetes medications.

As an accredited American Diabetes Association program, we offer comprehensive classes in diabetes management, and support groups are available for established patients.

The Diabetes Care Center is an internationally renowned participant in clinical research trials that help inform our understanding of the disease.

attributes.title: Pituitary Program at UW Medical Center

body.value:
Pituitary gland disorder evaluation, management and cures

The Pituitary Program at UW Medical Center provides comprehensive treatment to patients with disorders of the pituitary gland and hypothalamus. The specialists on our team—including neuro-endocrinologists, neurosurgeons, radiation oncologists, neuro-radiologists and neuro-ophthalmologists—are experts in diagnosing, treating and curing pituitary and hypothalamic disorders. 

UW Medicine’s pituitary surgeons use Endoscopic Transnasal Transsphenoidal Surgery (TSS), a minimally invasive procedure in which your surgeon uses an angled endoscope to remove the pituitary tumor. TSS is useful in treating some of the most complex pituitary tumors. If you have a syndrome resulting from hormone overproduction—such as Cushing’s disease or acromegaly—and you can’t have surgery or surgery hasn’t been effective, our endocrinologists can develop a plan to manage your disorder. If your pituitary gland isn’t working correctly, our endocrinologists are also highly experienced in the precise management of hormone replacement therapy.

The clinic also offers detailed outpatient evaluation, including thorough office visits, hormone testing, radiology studies (such as an MRI) and vision exams. We are committed to excellence in patient care, to the advancement of knowledge regarding all aspects of pituitary diseases, and to the education and involvement of referring physicians in the care of their patients referred to our clinic.​​

body.value:
Better health through nutrition for adults and kids at UW Medical Center-Roosevelt

At the UW Medical Center-Roosevelt Nutrition Clinic, our providers are highly trained registered dietitians who work with your medical team. We specialize in providing medical nutrition therapy to adults and children.

Our dietitians provide education on lifestyle and dietary changes to help you improve your health. They develop an individualized nutrition plan that addresses your lifestyle and dietary needs, and will support you as you make changes to reach your goals.

Because good nutrition affects the whole family, we encourage you to bring a family member or significant other to your appointment.

attributes.title: Madison Clinic at Harborview

body.value:
Specialized HIV / AIDS Care at Harborview

The Madison Clinic at Harborview offers medical care and social services for persons living with HIV/AIDS, regardless of sexual orientation, gender identity, race or ability to pay. Our mental healthcare professionals provide a range of services for patients with HIV/AIDS, including psychiatric consultations, medication management and recommendations for continued psychiatric care.

We also provide medical care to HIV-negative persons who might benefit from having an HIV/AIDS expert involved in their medical care, including those who are interested in pre-exposure prophylaxis (PrEP) for HIV prevention.

The Madison Clinic is home to the UW AIDS Clinical Trials Unit (ACTU), part of a network of sites around world that receive funding from the National Institutes of Health to conduct research studies on HIV-related treatments in adults. These trials cover a range of HIV clinical research including evaluations of the best initial treatment for people starting treatment for HIV and treatment options for those with drug-resistant HIV. Trials also include those evaluating the best management of complications of HIV or its treatment, including trials for people with bone mineral loss, elevated blood fats, neurologic complications and body fat changes. We have been enrolling HIV research studies since 1986.

Appointments and referrals:

New patients should call the Patient Care Coordinator at 206-744-5155 to schedule their first appointment. The initial review will cover the medical history, current health, previous healthcare providers, and medical coverage.

Routine appointments may be made by calling 206-744-5100. Established patients may be seen on an urgent walk-in basis when appointments are available by calling the clinic or walking-in and speaking with a triage nurse.

Transferring care to the Madison Clinic:

Important note for new patients to Harborview Medical Center and who are currently on HIV medications: If you do not have any more refills please contact the clinic’s patient care coordinator at 206.744.5155 ASAP to schedule your first appointment to establish care BEFORE you run low or out of your medication.

To order refills at the Madison Clinic pharmacy:

  • Patient refills line: (206) 744-5151
  • Patient refills online

*Refills may be picked up in the outpatient pharmacy after hours if indicated.

Please indicate the following when ordering refills:

  • Name and Harborview ID number
  • Name of medication(s) and/or prescription number
  • When you want to pick them up

*Please allow 48 hours to process refills.

Disclaimer :
Madison Clinic recommends that prior to making any medical or treatment related decisions for HIV-infected individuals based exclusively on the information appearing in this website, patients and practitioners should first consult with HIV/AIDS trained practitioners and pharmacists. The Madison Clinic assumes no responsibility for adverse outcomes which may be construed to be the result of decisions about treatment based exclusively on information contained on this website. Because of the rapidly changing nature of information about HIV treatment and therapies, prescribers, pharmacists and patients should gather as much information as possible before making health management decisions. Such decisions should always be made in consultation between a physician and a patient.

attributes.title: Alvord Brain Tumor Center at UW Medical Center

body.value:
Comprehensive, compassionate care for brain tumor patients

Patients come to the Alvord Brain Tumor Center from across the country for expert and holistic care that includes a precise diagnosis, a personalized care plan and a team of experts who guide them each step of the way, from consultation to treatment and follow-up.

Your care team includes UW Medicine neurooncologists, neurosurgeons, medical and radiation oncologists, neuropathologists, magnate-certified oncology nurses, and cancer specialists who work together to treat all brain and spinal cord cancers, including meningiomas, gliomas, vestibular schwannomas, central nervous system lymphomas, ependymomas, recurrent brain tumors and metastatic cancers.

We offer access to leading-edge techniques, technologies and treatments such as Gamma Knife, proton and photon radiation therapies, chemotherapies (oral and infused), immunotherapies and Optune.

A staff social worker will support you and answer any questions you and your loved ones may have throughout the course of your care. You may also be eligible for clinical research trials that are available through our partner, the Fred Hutchinson Cancer Research Center.

Services also include breast reduction, facial re-animation, implant removal, sarcoma reconstruction, skin cancer treatments and skin reduction after weight loss.

attributes.title: Otolaryngology-Head and Neck Surgery Center at UW Medical Center

body.value:
Comprehensive ear, nose and throat diagnosis, treatment and surgery services at UW Medical Center

Located at UW Medical Center, our specialty clinic has fellowship-trained surgeons, who assess and treat all head and neck conditions.

Our specialists care for patients with otology and vestibular disorders, nasal obstruction and breathing issues, chronic sinusitis, tumors at the base of the skull and laryngeal conditions, as well as patients needing head and neck surgery or facial plastic and reconstructive surgery.

Often the causes of such disorders are not immediately evident so the team’s clinical experience with diagnostic tools is vital to setting out a treatment plan that has the best likelihood of success.

Often the causes of such disorders are not immediately evident so the team’s clinical experience with diagnostic tools is vital to setting out a treatment plan that has the best likelihood of success.

attributes.title: Liver Tumor Clinic at UW Medical Center

body.value:
The Center for Advanced Minimally Invasive Liver Oncologic Therapy 

The Center for Advanced Minimally Invasive Liver Oncologic Therapy (CAMILOT) at UW Medical Center is the treatment arm of the Liver Tumor Clinic. The Liver Tumor Clinic is the Pacific Northwest’s longest operating multidisciplinary clinic, offering patients a central location for consultations about malignant or benign liver tumors.

Our clinic is staffed with board-certified specialists from the disciplines of interventional radiology, diagnostic radiology, surgical oncology, pathology, hepatology, transplant services and medical oncology. We meet every Tuesday and Wednesday to develop a comprehensive diagnostic and treatment plan for each of our patients. UW Medicine and Seattle Cancer Care Alliance (SCCA) are recognized every year by U.S. News & World Report as one of the nation’s best. We put you and your family first and at the center of your care.

Unlike traditional therapies, which often require a long-term hospital stay for recovery, CAMILOT’s therapeutic approach strives to reduce in-hospital recovery time to a minimum, and often delivers therapies as outpatient procedures.

CAMILOT treats liver cancer patients using advanced, minimally-invasive approaches safely delivered with the least amount of stress to the patient’s body to minimize suffering, enhance recovery at home and return patients to quality and meaningful living.

attributes.title: Radiation Oncology Services at UW Medical Center

body.value:
Top-ranked radiation therapy for all types of cancer

The Radiation Oncology Services team at UW Medical Center provides comprehensive and personalized evaluation, consultation, diagnosis, planning, radiotherapy and follow-up for all of our cancer patients and patients with non-malignant conditions.

Radiation therapy services are provided on both an inpatient and outpatient basis. UW Medicine and Seattle Cancer Care Alliance (SCCA) are recognized every year by U.S. News & World Report as one of the nation’s best. We put you and your family at the center of your care.

We treat patients Monday through Friday, and patients with urgent and emergency needs can receive treatment on weekends and holidays as needed.

attributes.title: Esophageal and Gastric Diseases Clinic at UW Medical Center

body.value:
Digestive tract diagnostics and surgical consultation at UW Medical Center

The Esophageal and Gastric Diseases Clinic at UW Medical Center evaluates the function of the digestive tract, focusing on the esophagus and the stomach, and provides surgical consultation by specialized surgeons.

Each of our surgeons is fellowship trained in minimally invasive surgery of the upper gastrointestinal tract (esophagus and stomach). Our multidisciplinary team evaluates many symptoms, including those related to gastroesophageal reflux disease (GERD), esophageal and gastric cancer, hiatal and paraesophageal hernias, achalasia, esophageal diverticula and other complex problems.

Our clinic offers magnetic sphincter augmentation (MSA) for the treatment of GERD. We also have the largest upper GI physiology lab in the country, which provides expert disease assessments and assures the most accurate treatment decisions.

We provide the highest quality, comprehensive cancer care for patients throughout their entire cancer care journey. UW Medicine and Seattle Cancer Care Alliance (SCCA) are recognized every year by U.S. News & World Report as one of the nation’s best. We put you and your family first and at the center of your care.

attributes.title: UW Neighborhood Ballard Clinic

body.value:
Comprehensive primary and urgent care, when and where you need it

Located on Leary Way and 15th Avenue NW, the UW Neighborhood Ballard Clinic is dedicated to providing personalized care throughout all stages of life.

Offering a convenient location and comprehensive care just minutes from work or home, we serve busy professionals and on-the-go families in Magnolia and Ballard neighborhoods like Sunset Hill, Loyal Heights, Whittier Heights and communities elsewhere.

Board-certified providers offer a complete spectrum of primary care services six days a week, including family medicine, internal medicine, behavioral health, travel medicine, nutrition services, on-site lab and digital X-ray facilities.

You’ll also find a host of other UW Medicine specialists on site, offering sports medicine, physical therapy, women’s health, cardiology and hip and knee services.

The clinic offers primary care appointments Monday through Saturday, including evenings and same-day appointments. Urgent care services are available seven days a week. UW Neighborhood Clinics also offer medical advice, 24 hours a day, 7 days a week. Use eCare to message your care team any time, or call your clinic during business hours and you'll receive a call back within a day. When the clinic is closed, you'll reach an after-hours consulting nurse service.

We accept most major insurance plans. Make your appointment today.

A note about patient safety:

UW Neighborhood Clinics are committed to providing care in the safest environment possible. We demonstrate our commitment by washing our hands before examinations, asking you to confirm your identity by verifying your name and date of birth at key times and asking you to confirm the medications and allergies listed in your medical record to avoid errors, allergic reactions and drug interactions.

Our clinics do not provide supervision for children, but we are concerned for their safety during your visit. You or a responsible person must directly supervise children at all times while in the building. Please do not allow children to play near equipment, as they could injure themselves or damage the equipment.

Comprehensive primary care in Northgate, when and where you need it

Conveniently located along I-5 near the Northgate Transit Center, the UW Neighborhood Northgate Clinic offers primary care appointments six days a week, including evenings and same-day appointments. For added convenience, medical advice is available 24 hours a day, 7 days a week. Use eCare to message your care team any time, or call your clinic during business hours and you'll receive a call back within a day. When the clinic is closed, you'll reach an after-hours consulting nurse service.

Board-certified providers offer a complete spectrum of primary care services including family medicine with obstetrics, geriatrics, behavioral health, travel medicine, nutrition services, reproductive health and sports medicine. For your convenience, an on-site lab and digital X-ray facilities are available to you.

The UW Neighborhood Northgate Clinic is also a training site for the UW Family Medicine Residency program, creating a community-based training site for family medicine resident physicians.

The care team at the UW Neighborhood Northgate Clinic is dedicated to providing personalized care throughout all stages of life, and the clinic has been awarded recognition by the National Committee for Quality Assurance Patient-Centered Medical Home Program.

We accept most major insurance plans. Make your appointment for primary care services today.

A note about patient safety:

UW Neighborhood Clinics are committed to providing care in the safest environment possible. We demonstrate our commitment by washing our hands before examinations, asking you to confirm your identity by verifying your name and date of birth at key times and asking you to confirm the medications and allergies listed in your medical record to avoid errors, allergic reactions and drug interactions.

Our clinics do not provide supervision for children, but we are concerned for their safety during your visit. You or a responsible person must directly supervise children at all times while in the building. Please do not allow children to play near equipment, as they could injure themselves or damage the equipment.
